headline: Bank of America Announces Full Redemption of Its Series DD Preferred Stock and Related Depositary Shares
summary: Bank of America Corporation announced today that it will redeem all outstanding shares of its Fixed-to-Floating Rate Non-Cumulative Preferred Stock, Series DD (CUSIP No. 060505EV2), liquidation preference $25,000 per share (the "Preferred Stock"), and the corresponding depositary shares each representing a 1/25th interest in a share of the Preferred Stock (CUSIP No. 060505EU4) (the "Depositary Shares").

headline: BofA cuts storage REITS, Public Storage, Extra Space and Americold
summary: Investing.com -- Self-storage and cold-storage real estate investment trusts may struggle to sustain recent share gains as demand catalysts remain limited and operating conditions stay constrained.

headline: BofA lists 5 best stocks as AI spending directly benefits Gas
summary: Investing.com -- Bank of America says investor rotation out of technology and into energy has intensified, but the move has largely bypassed natural gas producers, a gap the bank argues is increasingly attractive.

headline: BofA Adjusts Sea Limited (SE) EPS Forecast, Confirms Buy Rating
summary: We recently published an article titled 12 High Growth E-commerce Stocks To Buy. On January 15, Bank of America lowered its price target on Sea Limited (NYSE:SE) to $182 from $200 while maintaining a Buy rating on the shares. The adjustment reflects higher planned investments, which led the firm to trim near-term margin and EPS […]

summary: The country’s second-largest lender is investing heavily in digital enhancements, increased marketing and a refresh to its rewards program, a bank executive said.

headline: TCM Group A/S: Major shareholder announcement

headline: BofA Reworks Credit Cards to Fuel Ambitious Consumer Profit Plan
summary: Reworking the rewards program is one lever the firm is pulling in its effort to lift the annual profit of the consumer unit to $20 billion by the end of the decade, a feat that’s been achieved only twice in the history of the US banking industry.  As part of the broader consumer push, executives said in interviews that they’re deploying millions of dollars and using artificial intelligence in a bid to lure new customers and persuade existing ones to do more business with the bank.  “The focus is on growth,” said Holly O’Neill, 54, head of Bank of America’s consumer business.

raw.headline: BofA Reworks Credit Cards to Fuel Ambitious Consumer Profit Plan
raw.summary: Reworking the rewards program is one lever the firm is pulling in its effort to lift the annual profit of the consumer unit to $20 billion by the end of the decade, a feat that’s been achieved only twice in the history of the US banking industry.  As part of the broader consumer push, executives said in interviews that they’re deploying millions of dollars and using artificial intelligence in a bid to lure new customers and persuade existing ones to do more business with the bank.  “The focus is on growth,” said Holly O’Neill, 54, head of Bank of America’s consumer business.

headline: BofA moves Equinor down to Neutral on limited share price upside
summary: Investing.com -- Bank of America (BofA) downgraded Norwegian oil group Equinor (NYSE:EQNR) (OL:EQNR) to Neutral, saying the shares now offer limited upside as they now trade close to the bank’s price objective (PO) of 260 Norwegian crowns.

headline: 7 Bank Stocks With Solid—and Growing—Dividends
summary: “One of the things that we like about them is that they’re more resilient, and we haven’t seen excessive credit erosion,” says Matt Quinlan, a manager of the $4.7 billion  fund, citing the overall quality of loan portfolios for these banks.  Betsy Graseck, global head of banks and diversified financial research at  Morgan Stanley  points out that the large-cap U.S. banks have plenty of excess capital.  This allows them to buy back a lot of stock, often more than they allocate for dividends.

raw.headline: 7 Bank Stocks With Solid—and Growing—Dividends

This allows them to buy back a lot of stock, often more than they allocate for dividends.

headline: BofA Lifts PT on PepsiCo (PEP) to $173 From $164
summary: PepsiCo, Inc. (NASDAQ:PEP) is one of the best confectionery, cookie, and snack stocks to buy. On February 4, BofA lifted the price target on PepsiCo, Inc. (NASDAQ:PEP) to $173 from $164 while maintaining a Neutral rating on the shares. The rating update followed PepsiCo, Inc.’s (NASDAQ:PEP) release of its fiscal Q4 and full-year 2025 financial results […]
